item.title: Call Stack
item.description: Call stack is a stack data structure that stores information about active subroutines1 of computer program. Subroutines is a sequence of program instructions that performs a specific task, packaged as a unit. ↩︎

item.title: Function Call
item.description: Example of function call Here’s an example of function call written in Javascript. function greet(name){ console.log(`Hello ${name}!`); greet2(name); console.log('Getting ready to say bye...'); bye(); } function greet2(name){ console.log(`How are you, ${name}?`); } function bye(){ console.log('OK bye!'); } greet('Mina'); Steps explanation Memory to store the name Maggie and greetfunction console.log(Hello Mina!); Allocate the second memory box upon the first with: function greet2 Name: Maggie console.log(How are you, Mina?
